Speaker: Mr SPEAKER
Title: Unknown
text: Hon. Sir Littleton Groom) took the chair at 3 p.m., and read prayers. MINISTERIALCHANGE S.

Speaker: Mr BRUCE
Title: Unknown
text: Flinders-Prime Minister and Minister for External Affairs ) [3.2] -(B y leave.)- I desire to announce an alteration in the personnel of the Government. As honourable members are aware, the honourable member for Calare (Sir Neville Howse), suffered, last year, a very serious illness which necessitated his relinquishing the portfolio of Minister for Defence. In the consequent reallotment of offices, the honourable member for Parkes (Mr M a r r ) , who had been an Honorary Minister, became Minister for Home and Territories. I am glad to say that the health of the honourable member for Calare has been completely restored, and that he has again accepted a portfolio. He will administer the Department for Home and Territories and the Department of Health, and the honourable member for Parkes will resume his previous position as an Honorary Minister. MOTION OF CENSURE .

Speaker: Mr CHARLTON
Title: Unknown
text: I give notice that tomorrow I shall moveTliat in the opinion of this House, the Gois deserving of severe censure for its failure to adequately protect Australian industries, and to limit migration to the nation's ability to absorb now arrivals, together with its neglect to formulate proposals to dcu.1 with unemployment.

Speaker: Mr BRUCE
Title: Unknown
text: As , on the re-assembling of the Parliament for what is virtually a new session, the Leader of the Opposition has given notice of a direct motion Of censure on the Government, I shall follow the parliamentary procedure which IB usual in the circumstances, and, therefore, move That the House do now adjourn. Question resolved in the affirmative. House adjourned at-3.4 p.m.
